description: Surrogate unique identifier for each logged upgrade failure event; used as primary key in this table.
Name of the originating table whose row failed during the upgrade or migration process.
Identifier of the specific row in the source table associated with this failure.
Human-readable error or warning text captured from the upgrade process explaining why the row could not be upgraded.
Numeric indicator of failure seriousness (e.g., warning vs error); mapping may vary by system; confirm with SME.
Timestamp when this failure record was last updated by the system or a user.
Identifier of the user or process that created the failure record; likely system-generated; confirm with SME.
Timestamp when the failure record was first created.
Identifier of the user or process that last modified the record.
Timestamp of the most recent user-initiated modification to the record.
